thread.title: Gay Aussie cowboy fights back against death threats and slurs
thread.title_full: Gay Aussie cowboy fights back against death threats and slurs

title: Gay Aussie cowboy fights back against death threats and slurs
text:
Gay Aussie cowboy fights back against death threats and slurs By 9NEWS 
A gay cowboy from the New South Wales central coast has proved the buck stops with him after he took to social media to fight back against death threats he received from other riders. 
Joshua Goyne, 18, claims online trolls attacked him because of his sexuality, one saying it would be good if he died from AIDS. 
“Today I was asked if I thought it was good that gays died of AIDS, and then the guy said he wished it was 1850 so he could shoot me for being a f---,” Mr Goyne said in a two-minute video posted to Facebook yesterday. 
“The fact I am getting death threats just for going to a rodeo is disgusting and these people are the scum of the earth.” 
Mr Goyne, who started the Facebook page ‘The Gay Cowboy’ said he faces threats “daily”, but it would not stop him from riding in the rodeo circuit. 
“They think they’re going to stop me from riding this weekend’s rodeo? Not a chance in hell. 
"I will proudly stand up to any homophobe and say right to their face that I'm a proud, openly gay cowboy. 
"It doesn't make you any less of a person nor, be it, a cowboy.” 
He also emphasised the "terrible problem" with homophobia in rural areas of the country. 
"Rural Australia has a terrible problem with homophobia and it needs to stop." 
Mr Goyne’s video has already been viewed 23,000 times. © Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
